lead_paragraph: The Indiana Fever acquired Katie Douglas, an All-Star forward and an Indianapolis native, in a trade with the Connecticut Sun. The Fever sent forward Tamika Whitmore, the 12th pick in this year’s W.N.B.A. draft and the rights to the former Duke guard Jessica Foley to the Sun. The trade came at Douglas’s request. Douglas, 28, was a star for Purdue and led the Boilermakers to the N.C.A.A. title in 1999. She averaged 17.0 points, 4.6 rebounds and 3.7 assists last season for the Sun and was a second-team All-W.N.B.A. guard.
